page.title: 04GUNTON St.PETER'S CHURCH
page.content: The most striking feature of the church is without doubt its round tower.Many such-like towers were built by the Saxons to protect them from the marauding norsemen.There are believed to be only 174 in the country,160 of which are to be found in Norfolk and Suffolk.The tower was built with a narrow arched opening suggesting that the tower was used as a sanctuary from the norsemen.The tower was built in 12ft. high sections,each layer settling before another was added.The walls are 5ft. thick,circular on the outside, and square on the inside.The first church at Gunton was probably Norman and built of wood,this being replaced later by a stone building.
